title: Authors and Citation

title: Automated Stock Assessment Reporting
text: package currently development. users interested testing, please see Testing section . current form, package builds simple template, limited features including NOAA Fisheries formatting included tables figures. Download using directions fill create_template.R function desired parameters (follow example ) create template quarto document rendered create stock assessment report. goal ASAR automate stock assessment reports NOAA science centers reproducible cohesive across nation. project intends create streamlined workflow allows analyst create customized report tailored needs requirements SSC, council, regional management organizations.

title: Automated Stock Assessment Reporting
text: First please check make sure tinytex package installed machine. please install using following lines: install package:
code: install.packages("tinytex") library(tinytex) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("Schiano-NOAA/ASAR")

title: Automated Stock Assessment Reporting
text: following basic example render stock assessment report particular region U.S.: Note: example. parameters example convey accurate stock assessment information.
code: ASAR::create_template(   new_template = TRUE,   format = "pdf",   office = "SWFSC",   species = "Pacific sardine",   spp_latin = "Sardinops sagax",   year = 2024,   author = c("John Snow", "Danny Phantom", "Patrick Star"),   include_affiliation = TRUE,   parameters = FALSE,   model_results = "Report.SSO",   model = "SS" )

title: Automated Stock Assessment Reporting
text: encourage users test asar throughout development. Please use example get basic understanding create stock assessment template. user successfully executes create_template(), template quarto file open: associated files created folder called stock_assessment_reports within user’s documents folder. , file system following user’s associated science center > species name > region (applicable) > year. user navigate folder find additional files. modularized template, need make edits skeleton file. write report, user navigate open supporting section quarto document labeled: Executive Summary Introduction Data Modeling Approach Results Projections Discussion Acknowledgments References Tables Figures Please leave issue bugs suggestions improve package testing Issues Page. Please remember package currently development project release version 1.0 December 2024. Thank helping us improve package!

title: Automated Stock Assessment Reporting
text: receive error creating template due authorship. Please submit requests added national archive assessment scientists using issue. developers add list soon possible. meantime, can use argument create_template(add_author = "First Last") add template.

title: Automated Stock Assessment Reporting
text: package intended use stock assessment analysts across NOAA Fisheries, modularized process workflow can used applications developing reports managing organizations rendering stock assessment reports regions world. Feel free report issues package GitHub Issue Page questions regarding package GitHub discussion board. create issue, please see status beginning page check package operational still early stages development.

title: Write R Chunk to Add Child Document — add_child
text: x section .qmd file add template, options sections 'skeleton' folder; select XX_section.qmd files , b, c... subfiles label description child document added (short - one/two words max)

title: Write R Chunk to Add Child Document — add_child
text: Formatting R chunk child document add section template/skeleton. Utilize cat() function implement readable text.

title: Write R Chunk to Add Child Document — add_child
code:
add_child("test_quarto.qmd", label = "test_doc") #> [1] "
 {{< pagebreak >}} 

```{r, results='asis'}
#| label: 'test_doc'
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
a <- knitr::knit_child('test_quarto.qmd', quiet = TRUE)
cat(a, sep = '\n')
```
"

what: Write R chunk to template — add_chunk
title: Write R chunk to template — add_chunk
text: Write R chunk template

title: Write R chunk to template — add_chunk
code: add_chunk(   x,   echo = "false",   warnings = "false",   eval = "true",   label = NULL,   add_option = FALSE,   chunk_op = NULL )

title: Write R chunk to template — add_chunk
text: x content within R chunk written contained inside quotation marks echo repeat code document; default false warnings Report warnings console render? Default false eval Evaluate chunk? default true label name chunk 'label:' section r code chunk; snakecase add_option TRUE/FALSE add additional chunk options? default FALSE chunk_op list chunk options add; example: c("output: true", "error: false)

title: Write R chunk to template — add_chunk
text: Write additional R chunk template using function. code can written usual, just remember put entirely quotes function render properly

title: Write R chunk to template — add_chunk
code:
add_chunk("plot(cars$speed, cars$distance)") #> [1] "```{r} 
''
#| echo: false 
#| warning: false 
#| eval: true 
plot(cars$speed, cars$distance)
``` 
"

title: Add New Section to Template — add_section
text: sec_names section_names subsection. Please keep short template created quarto document skeleton saved later reference. one section can added. Please make list desired. location section added generic template using notation 'placement-section'. Example '-introduction' new content created child document added 02_introduction.qmd. option add one section. Add location list corresponding order section names listed 'title' parameter other_sections List sections added sections combined (NULL) subdir directory new sections saved - create_template fxn defaults location template saved

title: Add New Section to Template — add_section
text: Add additional section report template already default template. provides option adding subsection either within subsection child document.

title: Add New Section to Template — add_section
code: add_section(   sec_names = "Ecosystem Considerations", location = "after-discussion",   other_sections = c("introduction.qmd", "model.qmd", "results.qmd", "discussion.qmd"),   subdir = tempdir() ) #> [1] "introduction.qmd"             "model.qmd"                    #> [3] "results.qmd"                  "discussion.qmd"               #> [5] "Ecosystem_Considerations.qmd"

title: Add NOAA formatting to figure or table — add_theme
text: Add standard formatting stock assessment reports figure table. Currently, function able format objects : ggplot (ggplot2), base r plot, flextable (flextable), gt tables (gt), kable tables (kableExtra).

code: add_theme(ggplot2::ggplot(data = cars, ggplot2::aes(x = speed, y = dist)) +   ggplot2::geom_point())

title: Generate Citation for Stock Assessment Report — create_citation
text: author author list- inherited template function using title title report - inherited template function using year year report citation purposes office NOAA line office report processed

title: Generate Citation for Stock Assessment Report — create_citation
text: Generate citation use publications references stock assessment report generated ASAR package.

title: Generate Citation for Stock Assessment Report — create_citation
code: create_citation(   title = "SA Report for Jellyfish",   author = c("John Snow", "Danny Phantom", "Patrick Star"),   year = 2024, office = "NEFSC" ) #> Error in if (author != "") {    if (length(unlist(strsplit(author[1], " "))) == 3) {        primauth_loc <- dplyr::filter(utils::read.csv(system.file("resources",             "authorship.csv", package = "ASAR", mustWork = TRUE)),             last == unlist(strsplit(author[1], " "))[3])    }    else {        primauth_loc <- dplyr::filter(utils::read.csv(system.file("resources",             "authorship.csv", package = "ASAR", mustWork = TRUE)),             last == unlist(strsplit(author[1], " "))[2])    }    if (nrow(primauth_loc) > 1) {        primauth_loc <- dplyr::filter(utils::read.csv(system.file("resources",             "authorship.csv", package = "ASAR", mustWork = TRUE)),             last == unlist(strsplit(author[1], " "))[1])    }    office_loc <- dplyr::filter(utils::read.csv(system.file("resources",         "affiliation_info.csv", package = "ASAR", mustWork = TRUE)),         affiliation == primauth_loc$office)    if (nrow(office_loc) > 1) {        stop("There is more than one office being selected in this function. Please review 'generate_ciation.R'.")    }    loc_city <- office_loc$city    loc_state <- office_loc$state    if (length(author) > 1) {        author1 <- unlist(strsplit(author[1], split = " "))        author1 <- paste0(ifelse(length(author1) == 3, author1[3],             author1[2]), ", ", substring(author1[1], 1, 1), ".",             ifelse(length(author1) == 3, author1[2], ""))        author_list <- paste0(author1)        for (i in 2:length(author)) {            auth_extract <- unlist(strsplit(author[i], split = " "))            auth_extract2 <- paste0(substring(auth_extract[1],                 1, 1), ".", ifelse(length(auth_extract) == 3,                 auth_extract[2], ""), " ", ifelse(length(auth_extract) ==                 3, auth_extract[3], auth_extract[2]))            author_list <- paste0(author_list, ", ", auth_extract2)        }    }    else {        author_spl <- unlist(strsplit(author, split = " "))        author_list <- paste0(ifelse(length(author_spl) == 3,             author_spl[3], author_spl[2]), ", ", substring(author_spl[[1]][1],             1, 1), ".", ifelse(length(author_spl) == 3, author_spl[2],             ""))    }}: the condition has length > 1

what: Create Stock Assessment Report Template. To see templates included in the base skeleton, please run 'list.files(system.file('templates','skeleton', package = 'ASAR'))' in the console. — create_template
title: Create Stock Assessment Report Template. To see templates included in the base skeleton, please run 'list.files(system.file('templates','skeleton', package = 'ASAR'))' in the console. — create_template
text: Create Stock Assessment Report Template. see templates included base skeleton, please run 'list.files(system.file('templates','skeleton', package = 'ASAR'))' console.

title: Create Stock Assessment Report Template. To see templates included in the base skeleton, please run 'list.files(system.file('templates','skeleton', package = 'ASAR'))' in the console. — create_template
code: create_template(   new_template = TRUE,   format = c("pdf", "docx", "html", NULL),   office = c("AFSC", "PIFSC", "NEFSC", "NWFSC", "SEFSC", "SWFSC"),   region = NULL,   complex = "NO",   species = NULL,   spp_latin = NULL,   year = NULL,   author = "",   add_author = NULL,   include_affiliation = FALSE,   simple_affiliation = TRUE,   alt_title = FALSE,   title = NULL,   parameters = TRUE,   param_names = NULL,   param_values = NULL,   resdir = NULL,   model_results = NULL,   model = NULL,   new_section = NULL,   section_location = NULL,   type = "SAR",   prev_year = NULL,   custom = FALSE,   custom_sections = NULL,   include_figures = TRUE,   include_tables = TRUE )

title: Create Stock Assessment Report Template. To see templates included in the base skeleton, please run 'list.files(system.file('templates','skeleton', package = 'ASAR'))' in the console. — create_template
text: new_template TRUE/FALSE; default false otherwise true, pull last saved stock assessment report skeleton format File type render (.e. pdf, docx, html) office Regional fisheries science center producing report (AFSC, NEFSC, NWFSC, PIFSC, SEFSC, SWFSC) region Full name region species evaluated applicable; Note: specified center species, use variable. complex species complex? "YES" "" species Full common name target species, split naming space capitalize first letter(s) spp_latin Latin name target species assessment year Year assessment conducted, default current year report rendered author List authors include assessment; keep authorship order add_author temporarily add author currently database. Follow format "First MI Last". Please leave comment github issues page added. include_affiliation TRUE/FALSE; analyst want include affiliations authors document? simple_affiliation including affiliation, adding just office name rather full address; TRUE/FALSE, default TRUE alt_title TRUE/FALSE create alternative title default title Name new title default appropriate; Example, "Management Track Assessments Spring 2024" parameters TRUE/FALSE; default TRUE - parameterization script param_names List parameter names called document; parameters automatically included office, region, species listed function parameters param_values List values associated order parameter names; parameters automatically included office, region, species listed function parameters resdir Directory model results file(s) located model_results Name model results file model Type assessment model used assess stock (.e. "BAM", "SS3", "AMAK", "ASAP", ect) new_section File name new section section_location Location section added relative base skeleton document type Type report build - default SAR prev_year Year previous assessment report conducted - pulling previous assessment template custom TRUE/FALSE Build custom sectioning template rather default stock assessments region custom_sections List sections want include custom template. Note: includes sections within 'templates' > 'skeleton'. section name can used 'abstract' rather entire name '00_abstract.qmd'. new section added, please also use parameters 'new_section', 'section_location' include_figures Determine figures included report include_tables Indicate tables included report

title: Create Stock Assessment Report Template. To see templates included in the base skeleton, please run 'list.files(system.file('templates','skeleton', package = 'ASAR'))' in the console. — create_template
text: Create template pull skeleton stock assessment report. Function builds YAML specific region utilizes current resources workflows different U.S. Fishery Science Centers. General sections called child documents skeleton child documents edited separately.

title: Create Stock Assessment Report Template. To see templates included in the base skeleton, please run 'list.files(system.file('templates','skeleton', package = 'ASAR'))' in the console. — create_template
code: create_template(   new_template = TRUE, format = "pdf", office = "NEFSC", region = "GB",   species = "Atlantic Bluefish", spp_latin = "Pomatomus saltatrix", year = 2024,   author = c("John Snow", "Danny Phantom", "Patrick Star"), include_affiliation = TRUE,   parameters = TRUE, param_names = c("fleet1", "fleet2", "model"),   param_values = c("Commercial", "Recreational", "Woods Hole Assessment Model"),   type = "SAR", model_results = "results.Rdata", model = "WHAM" ) #> [1] "__________Built YAML Header______________" #> Error in if (author != "") {    if (length(unlist(strsplit(author[1], " "))) == 3) {        primauth_loc <- dplyr::filter(utils::read.csv(system.file("resources",             "authorship.csv", package = "ASAR", mustWork = TRUE)),             last == unlist(strsplit(author[1], " "))[3])    }    else {        primauth_loc <- dplyr::filter(utils::read.csv(system.file("resources",             "authorship.csv", package = "ASAR", mustWork = TRUE)),             last == unlist(strsplit(author[1], " "))[2])    }    if (nrow(primauth_loc) > 1) {        primauth_loc <- dplyr::filter(utils::read.csv(system.file("resources",             "authorship.csv", package = "ASAR", mustWork = TRUE)),             last == unlist(strsplit(author[1], " "))[1])    }    office_loc <- dplyr::filter(utils::read.csv(system.file("resources",         "affiliation_info.csv", package = "ASAR", mustWork = TRUE)),         affiliation == primauth_loc$office)    if (nrow(office_loc) > 1) {        stop("There is more than one office being selected in this function. Please review 'generate_ciation.R'.")    }    loc_city <- office_loc$city    loc_state <- office_loc$state    if (length(author) > 1) {        author1 <- unlist(strsplit(author[1], split = " "))        author1 <- paste0(ifelse(length(author1) == 3, author1[3],             author1[2]), ", ", substring(author1[1], 1, 1), ".",             ifelse(length(author1) == 3, author1[2], ""))        author_list <- paste0(author1)        for (i in 2:length(author)) {            auth_extract <- unlist(strsplit(author[i], split = " "))            auth_extract2 <- paste0(substring(auth_extract[1],                 1, 1), ".", ifelse(length(auth_extract) == 3,                 auth_extract[2], ""), " ", ifelse(length(auth_extract) ==                 3, auth_extract[3], auth_extract[2]))            author_list <- paste0(author_list, ", ", auth_extract2)        }    }    else {        author_spl <- unlist(strsplit(author, split = " "))        author_list <- paste0(ifelse(length(author_spl) == 3,             author_spl[3], author_spl[2]), ", ", substring(author_spl[[1]][1],             1, 1), ".", ifelse(length(author_spl) == 3, author_spl[2],             ""))    }}: the condition has length > 1

title: Write Stock Assessment Title — create_title
text: office Fishery science center performing assessment species Target species region Region stock assessed applicable. Please explicit name follow preferred convention management organization. year Year conducting assessment report complex TRUE/FALSE species complex? type Stock assessment type; usually inherited template spp_latin Latin name target species

title: Write Stock Assessment Title — create_title
code: create_title(   office = "SEFSC", species = "Red Snapper", region = "South Atlantic",   year = 2024, type = "SAR", spp_latin = "Lutjanus campechanus" ) #> [1] "SEDAR XX Assessment Report for Red Snapper (Lutjanus campechanus) in the South Atlantic in 2024"

title: Export report object — export_object
text: Objects put function put folder "exported" better organization; PUSH REPO

title: Export report object — export_object
text: Samantha Schiano

title: Export report object — export_object
code: source <- c("NMFS Groundfish Survey", "", "U.S. Trawl Fisheries", "", "") data <- c("Survey biomass", "Age Composition", "Catch", "Age Composition", "Length Composition") years <- c(   "1984-1999 (triennial), 2001-2013 (biennial)",   "1984, 1987, 1990, 1993, 1996, 1999, 2003, 2005, 2007, 2009, 2011", "1961-2013",   "1990,1998-2002, 2004, 2005, 2006, 2008, 2010", "1963-1977, 1991-1997" ) test_obj <- data.frame(source, data, years)  export_object(object = test_obj, file_format = "csv", subdir = "~")
